intro: Stichianthus minutiflorus, commonly known as the dwarf stichianthus, is a small, flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features delicate, palmate leaves and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses. Due to its limited natural range, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
